* lasers name of Folder.
I am sending the attached photos in hopes that they will be suitable
for use in the Kellogg report in lieu of the Hagerstown photo which
you returned to us .
Labeled on the back, two of the photos are from television station KETC,
St. Louis, Missouri and two are from the Chicago Board of Education
Division of Radio and Television.
We expect rough drawings from our University Press art department some¬
time today or tomorrow, whch I will forward immediately for your approval.
We noted that in some areas of the report, two colors are used. . . .black
and a reddish-brown. The drawings that will be submitted to us will be
conceived with these two tones in mind; however the brown may be changed
to a gray tone if it cannot be used. The artist advised this procedure since
it would be easier to visialize to_ black than to the different colors. When
we have heard from you, however, we may then make further adjustments
before the final layout in this respect.
Should you need additional information please call on us . I hope that
our progress thus far has been conformable to your own deadlines. We will
be sure to have the final layout to you by September 1st.
Sincerely,
(-jjCL*Us
(/ Jane Lombard
Editor
